solution: By the triangle inequality on triangle $ABC$, $BC > AC - AB = 12 - 5 = 7$, and by the triangle inequality on triangle $BCD$, $BC > BD - CD = 20 - 8 = 12$.  Hence, $BC$ must be at least $\boxed{13}$ centimeters.  (And it is easy to verify that it is possible for $BC$ to be 13 centimeters.
socratic_questions:

5. How do we apply the triangle inequality to triangle BCD?
6. What is the significance of finding the minimum integral number of centimeters in BC?
7. Can you explain why BC must be greater than 7 centimeters?
8. Can you explain why BC must be greater than 12 centimeters?
9. Why is the minimum possible integral number of centimeters in BC 13?
